007package renderer.models_T;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a solid model of a tetrahedron as a
015   triangular pyramid with an equilateral triangle
016   base (centered at the origin in the xz-plane)
017   whose three vertices are connected to a 4th vertex
018   on the positive y-axis.
019
020   @see Tetrahedron
021*/
022public class TriangularPyramid extends Model implements MeshMaker
023{
024   public final double r;
025   public final double h;
026   public final int n;
027   public final int k;
028
029   /**
030      Create a regular tetrahedron having side length
031      {@code sqrt(3)/sqrt(2)}, with one face in the
032      xz-plane with its center at the origin, and the
033      4th vertex on the positive y-axis at height 1.
034   */
035   public TriangularPyramid( )
036   {
037      this(Math.sqrt(3)/Math.sqrt(2)); // makes the height = 1
038      //or
039      //this(Math.sqrt(3));  // make the height = sqrt(2) > 1
040   }
041
042
043   /**
044      Create a regular tetrahedron having side length {@code s},
045      with one face in the xz-plane with its center at the origin,
046      and with the 4th vertex on the positive y-axis at
047      height {@code s*sqrt(2)/sqrt(3)}.
048
049      @param s  the length of the regular tetrahedron's sides
050   */
051   public TriangularPyramid(final double s)
052   {
053      this(s/Math.sqrt(3), s*Math.sqrt(2)/Math.sqrt(3));
054   }
055
056
057   /**
058      Create a tetrahedron with one face being an equilateral triangle
059      inscribed in a circle of radius {@code r} centered at the origin
060      of the xz-plane and with the 4th vertex on the y-axis at height
061      {@code h}.
062   <p>
063      If {@code h = r * sqrt(2)}, then the tetrahedron is a regular tetrahedron.
064      with side length {@code s = r * sqrt(3)}.
065   <p>
066      Another way to state this is, if an equilateral triangle is inscribed
067      in a circle of radius {@code r}, then the edge length of the triangle
068      is {@code r*sqrt(3)} and the height of the regular tetrahedron made
069      from the triangle is {@code r*sqrt(2)}.
070
071      @param r  radius of circle in xz-plane that the equilateral base is inscribed in
072      @param h  coordinate on the y-axis of the apex
073   */
074   public TriangularPyramid(final double r, final double h)
075   {
076      super(String.format("Triangular Pyramid(%.2f,%.2f)", r, h));
077
078      this.r = r;
079      this.h = h;
080      this.n = 1;
081      this.k = 1;
082
083      // Create the tetrahedron's geometry.
084      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0);
085      addVertex(new Vertex( r,   0,    0),  // three vertices around the bottom face
086                new Vertex(-r/2, 0,  r*0.5*sqrt3),
087                new Vertex(-r/2, 0, -r*0.5*sqrt3),
088                new Vertex( 0,   h,    0)); // vertex at the top
089
090      // Create 4 triangles.
091      addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 2),  // bottom face
092                   new Triangle(0, 3, 1),  // face 1
093                   new Triangle(1, 3, 2),  // face 2
094                   new Triangle(0, 2, 3)); // face 3
095   }
096
097
098   /**
099      Create a tetrahedron with one face being an equilateral triangle
100      inscribed in a circle of radius {@code r} centered at the origin
101      of the xz-plane and with the 4th vertex on the y-axis at height
102      {@code h}.
103   <p>
104      If {@code h = r * sqrt(2)}, then the tetrahedron is a regular tetrahedron.
105      with side length {@code s = r * sqrt(3)}.
106   <p>
107      Another way to state this is, if an equilateral triangle is inscribed
108      in a circle of radius {@code r}, then the edge length of the triangle
109      is {@code r*sqrt(3)} and the height of the regular tetrahedron made
110      from the triangle is {@code r*sqrt(2)}.
111
112      @param r  radius of circle in xz-plane that the equilateral base is inscribed in
113      @param h  coordinate on the y-axis of the apex
114      @param n  number of lines of latitude around the body of the pyramid
115      @param k  number of triangles in the triangle fan at the top of each side
116      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 1
117      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
118   */
119   public TriangularPyramid(final double r, final double h,
120                            final int n, final int k)
121   {
122      super(String.format("Triangular Pyramid(%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
123                                              r,   h,   n, k));
124
125      if (n < 1)
126         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 0");
127      if (k < 1)
128         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 0");
129
130      this.r = r;
131      this.h = h;
132      this.n = n;
133      this.k = k;
134
135      // Create the pyramid's geometry.
136      // An array of vertices to be used to create faces.
137      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][3*k];
138
139      // Create the vertices.
140      final Vertex apex = new Vertex(0, h, 0),
141                   centerVertex = new Vertex(0, 0, 0);
142
143      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0);
144      // Three vertices around the bottom face.
145      final Vertex v0 = new Vertex( r,   0,    0),
146                   v1 = new Vertex(-r/2, 0,  r*0.5*sqrt3),
147                   v2 = new Vertex(-r/2, 0, -r*0.5*sqrt3);
148
149      for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) // choose a height of latitude
150      {
151         final double y = i * (h / n);
152
153         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
154         final double t = i * (1.0 / n);
155         final Vertex vA = new Vertex( (1-t)*v0.x + t*apex.x,
156                                                           y,
157                                       (1-t)*v0.z + t*apex.z );
158         final Vertex vB = new Vertex( (1-t)*v1.x + t*apex.x,
159                                                           y,
160                                       (1-t)*v1.z + t*apex.z );
161         final Vertex vC = new Vertex( (1-t)*v2.x + t*apex.x,
162                                                           y,
163                                       (1-t)*v2.z + t*apex.z );
164
165         // Use linear interpolation again.
166         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
167         {
168            final double s = j * (1.0 / k);
169            v[i][j] = new Vertex( (1-s)*vA.x + s*vB.x,
170                                                    y,
171                                  (1-s)*vA.z + s*vB.z );
172
173            v[i][k+j] = new Vertex( (1-s)*vB.x + s*vC.x,
174                                                      y,
175                                    (1-s)*vB.z + s*vC.z );
176
177            v[i][2*k+j] = new Vertex( (1-s)*vC.x + s*vA.x,
178                                                        y,
179                                      (1-s)*vC.z + s*vA.z );
180         }
181      }
182
183      // Add the vertices to this model.
184      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
185      {
186         for (int j = 0; j < 3*k; ++j)
187         {
188            addVertex( v[i][j] );
189         }
190      }
191      addVertex(apex,
192                centerVertex);
193      final int apexIndex = n * 3*k,
194                centerIndex = apexIndex + 1;
195
196      // Create the triangle fan at the apex.
197      for (int j = 0; j < 3*k - 1; ++j)
198      {  //                                    v[n-1][j+1]       v[n-1][j]
199         addPrimitive(new Triangle(apexIndex, (n-1)*(3*k)+j+1, (n-1)*(3*k)+j));
200      }
201      //                                    v[n-1][0]     v[n-1][3k-1]
202      addPrimitive(new Triangle(apexIndex, (n-1)*(3*k)+0, (n-1)*(3*k)+3*k-1));
203
204      // Create all the square strips around the pyramid wall.
205      for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
206      {
207         for (int j = 0; j < 3*k - 1; ++j)
208         {  //                        v[i][j]    v[i+1][j]       v[i+1][j+1]
209            addPrimitive(new Triangle(i*(3*k)+j, (i+1)*(3*k)+j, (i+1)*(3*k)+j+1));
210            //                        v[i][j]    v[i+1][j+1]     v[i][j+1]
211            addPrimitive(new Triangle(i*(3*k)+j, (i+1)*(3*k)+j+1, i*(3*k)+j+1));
212         }
213         //                         v[i][3k-1]      v[i+1][3k-1]       v[i+1][0]
214         addPrimitive(new Triangle(i*(3*k)+3*k-1, (i+1)*(3*k)+3*k-1, (i+1)*(3*k)+0));
215         //                          v[i][3k-1]      v[i+1][0]     v[i][0]
216         addPrimitive(new Triangle(i*(3*k)+3*k-1, (i+1)*(3*k)+0, i*(3*k)+0));
217      }
218
219      // Create the triangle fan in the base.
220      for (int j = 0; j < 3*k - 1; ++j)
221      {  //                                     v[0][j]  v[0][j+1]
222         addPrimitive(new Triangle(centerIndex,    j,       j+1));
223      }
224      //                                    v[0][3k-1]  v[0][0]
225      addPrimitive(new Triangle(centerIndex,    3*k-1,      0));
226   }
227
228
229
230   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
231   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
232
233   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
234
235   @Override
236   public TriangularPyramid remake(final int n, final int k)
237   {
238      return new TriangularPyramid(this.r, this.h,
239                                   n, k);
240   }
241}//TriangularPyramid
